Notes: Time was officially recorded as 2:55:18 2/5.[53] Italian Dorando Pietri finished in 2:54:46.4, but was disqualified for receiving assistance from race officials near the finish.[54] Note.[55]

Name: Hannes Kolehmainen
Notes: The course distance was officially reported to be 42,750 meters/26.56 miles,[62] however, the Association of Road Racing Statisticians estimated the course to be 40 km.[10]

Name: Fusashige Suzuki
Notes: According to the Association of Road Racing Statisticians, Suzuki's 2:27:49 performance occurred in Tokyo on March 21, 1935, during a race in which he finished second to Sohn Kee-chung (sometimes referred to as Kee-Jung Sohn or Son Kitei) who ran a 2:26:14.[65]

Name: Yasuo Ikenaka
Notes: Note.[66]

Name: Sohn Kee-chung
Notes: Also romanized as Kitei Son. Note.[66]

Name: Suh Yun-bok
Notes: Disputed (short course).[67] Disputed (point-to-point).[68] Note.[69]

Name: Jim Peters
Notes: MarathonGuide.com states the course was slightly long.[70] Report in The Times claiming world record.[71]

Name: Jim Peters
Notes: Report in The Times claiming world record.[71]

Name: Jim Peters
Notes: Point-to-point course.[citation needed] Report in The Times claiming world record.[72]

Name: Sergei Popov
Notes: The ARRS notes Popov's extended time as 2:15:17.6[19]

Name: Abebe Bikila
Notes: World record fastest marathon run in bare feet.[73]

Name: Leonard Edelen
Notes: Point-to-point course.[citation needed] Report in The Times claiming world record and stating that the course may have been long.[74]

Name: Basil Heatley
Notes: Point-to-point course.[citation needed] Report in The Times claiming world record.[75]

Name: Morio Shigematsu
Notes: Point-to-point course.[citation needed] Report in The Times claiming world record.[76]

Name: Derek Clayton
Notes: Disputed (short course).[77]

Name: Ronaldo da Costa
Notes: First time the 40K mark was passed under two hours (1:59:55).[78]

Name: Khalid Khannouchi
Notes: First "World's Best" recognized by the International Association of Athletics Federations.[79] The ARRS notes Khannouchi's extended time as 2:05:37.8[19]

Name: Paul Tergat
Notes: First world record for the men's marathon ratified by the International Association of Athletics Federations.[80]

Name: Haile Gebrselassie
Notes: The ARRS notes Gebrselassie's extended time as 2:03:58.2.[19] Video on YouTube

Name: Wilson Kipsang
Notes: The ARRS notes Kipsang's extended time as 2:03:22.2[83]

Name: Dennis Kimetto
Notes: The ARRS notes Kimetto's extended time as 2:02:56.4[83]

Name: Kelvin Kiptum
Notes: First man to break 2:01:00 in a record-eligible marathon.
